summary: While serving a five-year sentence for a violent crime, a 12-year-old boy sues his parents for neglect.
synopsis: Capernaüm ("Chaos") tells the story of Zain (Zain al-Rafeea), a Lebanese boy who sues his parents for the "crime" of giving him life. The film follows Zain as he journeys from gutsy, streetwise child to hardened 12-year-old "adult" fleeing his negligent parents, surviving through his wits on the streets, where he meets Ethiopian migrant worker Rahil, who provides him with shelter and food, as Zain takes care of her baby son Yonas in return. Zain later gets jailed for committing a violent crime, and finally seeks justice in a courtroom.
stars: Zain Al Rafeea;Yordanos Shiferaw;Boluwatife Treasure Bankole
trivia: Highest grossing Arabic movie in China.
